result.execSummary:
The defendant Breon K Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breon K Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit. This is to be served straight time.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 12 MONTHS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
-No contact with or possession of gun, firearms, or ammunition
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Maintain school or an employment, or a combination of the school or employment
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
-Absolute sobriety
-40 hours of community service in an area related to the subjects of guns and/or drugs


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA).  Court will waive what it is able to due to an inability to pay.

Court ordered that if ALL conditions of the sentence are completed, the defendant can petition the Court for expunction in 18 months.

Appeal rights given.

Filed:    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Breon K Williams in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Breon K Williams in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel needs additional time to review discovery and requests an adjourned plea/sentencing date. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Breon K Williams in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Breon K Williams in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court is in trial on another matter.  State not available.  Defense requests another pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Breon K Williams in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  
Defendant Breon K Williams in custody.   
Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
